column4: i am trying to set up my microsoft mn-510 wireless usb card on ubuntu linux, which is based on debian, i downloaded the tar.gz file, and extracted to a .deb file. i then installed the .deb file. i am pretty much stuck now. i read alot of forums but they dont seem to tell me how to do it step by step. i am still learning thr ropes with this
ubuntu questions are not approriate for #debian
then get rid of the junk you downloaded
remove all that junk, ubuntu includes the driver already
uninstall all the junk you just installed, them come back
so when you said you had removed it, you were lying?
so, lying to people helping you is incredibly useless
then 'sudo wlanctl-ng wlan0 lnxreq_autojoin ssid="SSID" authtype=opensystem'
can you help me with that
try asking on the mailing lixst, I guess
